title: Ergo-First-Year-Token (EFYT)
summary: Ergo-First-Year-Token (EFYT) was systematically airdropped and listed on the Waves DEX in May 2017, with an initial supply of 100,000 tokens. This launch aimed to build an early community and raise capital before the Ergo mainnet launch. EFYT is separate from ERG, the native Ergo token. The maximum EFYT supply is capped at 1,970,945, mirroring 10% of Ergo's first-year token emission. EFYT holders could exchange their tokens for ERG at a 1:1 rate until July 1, 2021. EFYT was initially used for team compensation and operational costs, with 500,000 EFYT sold to private investors.

qa_pairs.question: What is EFYT?
qa_pairs.answer: EFYT is the Ergo-First-Year-Token, which was systematically airdropped and then listed on the Waves DEX in May 2017, with an initial supply of 100,000 tokens.

qa_pairs.question: How does EFYT differ from ERG?
qa_pairs.answer: EFYT, which was issued on the Waves Platform, is a separate entity from ERG, the native token of the Ergo blockchain. ERG became available after the launch of the Ergo mainnet and could only be obtained through mining.

qa_pairs.question: What is the total supply of EFYT?
qa_pairs.answer: The maximum supply of EFYT is capped at 1,970,945.0, mirroring 10% of Ergo's first-year token emission which corresponds to the amount of ERGs the Ergo Foundation received in this same period.

qa_pairs.question: Where can EFYT token distribution and market information be found?
qa_pairs.answer: EFYT token distribution can be found on Pywaves, and EFYT market and price tracking can be found on livecoinwatch.

qa_pairs.question: What was the EFYT redemption process?
qa_pairs.answer: EFYT holders could exchange their tokens for ERG at a 1:1 rate via the Waves gateway. This option was available until July 1st, 2021, with unclaimed EFYT tokens totaling 188,330 by the end of the offer. Overall, the Treasury exchanged 1,782,615 ERG for EFYT.

sections.content:

sections.heading: Ergo-First-Year-Token (EFYT)
Total Supply
sections.content:
The maximum supply of EFYT is capped at 1,970,945.0, mirroring 10% of Ergo's first-year token emission which corresponds to the amount of ERGs the [Ergo Foundation](ergo-foundation-2022.md) recieved in this same period.

- [EFYT token distribution on Pywaves](http://pywaves.org/assets/725Yv9oceWsB4GsYwyy4A52kEwyVrL5avubkeChSnL46).
- [EFYT market and price tracking on livecoinwatch](https://www.livecoinwatch.com/price/ErgoFirstYearToken-EFYT).

sections.heading: Redemption Process
sections.content: EFYT holders could exchange their tokens for ERG at a 1:1 rate via the Waves gateway. This option was available until July 1st, 2021, with unclaimed EFYT tokens totaling 188,330 by the end of the offer. Overall, the Treasury exchanged 1,782,615 ERG for EFYT.

sections.heading: Compensation and Expenses
sections.content: Initially, EFYT was used for team and external contributor compensation, and operational costs like server and integration expenses. In 2018, approximately 150,000 EFYT was allocated for compensation for developers.

sections.heading: Investors
sections.content: The project avoided a traditional ICO, opting for minimal private investment and focusing on accredited angel investors to align with regulatory standards. In total, 500,000 EFYT was sold to [three private investors](https://t.me/ergoplatform/3354).

sections.heading: Resources
sections.content:
Additional information and resources are included:

- [Kushti discussing EFYT in 2018](https://t.me/ergoplatform/3354).
- The team's hot wallet: [3P3yFxqAeFGnTDvCjeCEyMnMZevJxurKZne](https://wavesexplorer.com/assets/3P3yFxqAeFGnTDvCjeCEyMnMZevJxurKZne).
- Background on EFYT: [The Ergo Emission Schedule (2019)](https://ergoplatform.org/en/blog/2019_05_20-curve/).
